{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3336631,"name":"Ben Moeller","username":"benmoeller","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/cdc98d/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T01:24:53.546Z","cooked":"

We are using the rev 5v LED strips and we have daisy chained together two separate strips and one will light up and the other won’t. Is this simply because the rev 5v strips can’t be run on the same blinkin or do we need to have multiple blinkins? Below is a picture of our daisy chain.

IMG_24613024×4032 6.7 MB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-19T01:24:53.546Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":76,"readers_count":75,"score":45.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459199,"topic_slug":"rev-led-strips-not-lighting-up","display_username":"Ben Moeller","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/d/9/d9a9458abe495fc43552ced6d7160b3dfb8fb705.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59364,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-led-strips-not-lighting-up/459199/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3336635,"name":null,"username":"pixelpunk","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/96bed5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T01:28:35.887Z","cooked":"

Correct me if I’m wrong, but the connectors look like the wires are simply next to each other and not making contact. Make sure the wire is in at each end, not next to each other.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-19T01:28:35.887Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":12.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459199,"topic_slug":"rev-led-strips-not-lighting-up","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64486,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/rev-led-strips-not-lighting-up/459199/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3336647,"name":"Brett B Bonner","username":"bbonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-19T01:47:44.942Z","cooked":"

Do you have the directions going the same way? The signal line is directional, “out” must connect to “in”. Follow the arrows.

Also is the Blinkin set to a long enough length to drive the whole strip?

The copper pads on the strips are thin and it’s pretty easy to break a wire connection or lift a pad by accident. Use a voltmeter to make sure you have 5V all the way to the end of the second strip, then check all the signal connections.

I looked it up and set the blinkin to the right length and it worked, thank you.
